newsitem.title: JAPAN: DKB asset management firms say discussing merger.
newsitem.headline: DKB asset management firms say discussing merger.

text.p: Three investment management companies in the Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd (DKB) group are discussing a merger, two of the companies said on Tuesday.
"We are aiming to merge and will set up a group to negotiate details of the merger," a spokesman for Asahi Investment Trust Management Co told Reuters.
"We are considering a merger on October 1 as one possibility," Hiroshi Ote, president of Kankaku Capital Management Co, told Reuters.
"We hope to cooperate within the group in order to globalise our asset management operations and to cope with Japan's financial 'Big Bang'," Ote said.
The other company is Dai-Ichi Kangyo Investment Management Co. Kankaku Capital and Asahi Investment are affiliates of Kankaku Securities Co Ltd, which is also part of the Dai-Ichi Kangyo group.
The combined managed assets at the three firms is estimated at 2.5 trillion yen, the Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun said on Tuesday.
Asahi Investment mainly targets individuals, while the other two firms manage assets for pension funds and other institutional investors, the paper said.
